headline: [Breaking] PIB: Conference C’ttee adopts 3% equity share for host communities, 30% for frontier basin exploration

headline: Reps to investigate federal character violation in Nigerian Navy recruitment
summarized_story:

headline: Buhari Strategic In His Anti-corruption Drive – APC Group

headline: Sanwo-Olu mourns Lagos APC treasurer, Sumbo Ajose

summarized_story:
The House of Representatives on Thursday was thrown into a rowdy session over the three per cent allocation for the host community in the Petroleum Industry Bill.
The House is now in closed door meeting as Chinyere Igwe from Rivers state protested three per cent allocation to oil producing communities in the PIB.

headline: NSCDC deploys 2500 officers for Eid el Kabir in Oyo
summarized_story:
The Oyo state command of the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps said it has deployed over 2500 of it’s officers to every part of the state to ensure a hitch free Eid el Kabir celebration.
The Oyo state commandant of the NSCDC Michael Adaralewa made this known through a press release made available by the state’s Civil Defence public Relations Officer, Oluwole Olusegun.
The statement noted that the state commandant has also directed all the Area Commanders, Divisional officers, Agro Rangers, Counter Terrorism Unit and Disaster management unit as part of the 2500 officers deployed for the festive period.
He stressed that they will be positioned at all eid praying grounds, Recreational Parks, motor parks and other places of Interest so as to be fully guarded to ensure hitch free celebration.
Commandant Michael Adaralewa called on the parents and guidance to educate their children on the dangers involved in engaging in Vandalism and other negative vices.

headline: Photos: Buhari set to flag off Kaduna-Kano standard gauge railway
summarized_story:
President Muhammadu Buhari will today flag off the the Kaduna-Kano standard gauge railway in Kano state.
Present at the venue of the event are State governors, Ministers, Members of the National Assembly, Emir Of Kano and other Royal chiefs.
Recall that the minister of Transportation, Rotimi Amaechi, had earlier hinted that the project will soon be flagged off.
He gave the assurance while briefing state house correspondents in Abuja.

headline: Ethiopia’s Amhara Region Vows to Launch Fresh Attacks on Tigray
summarized_story:
Authorities in Ethiopia’s northern Amhara region have vowed to launch an offensive against forces from neighbouring Tigray, with the spokesman for the Amhara regional government stating patience had run out.
Tigray rebels have recaptured much of Tigray in recent weeks with Federal forces and their allies having to withdraw from key areas.
Tigrayan forces are pushing towards territory seized by the Amhara early on in the civil war.
With heightened tensions, this could lead to a fresh and even more bloody phase of the conflict.
But now, it risks not only tearing itself apart but increasing instability across one of the most fragile regions of Africa.

headline: Olympic Athletes to Put on Own Medals at Tokyo Ceremonies
summarized_story:
Athletes at the Tokyo Olympics will put their medals around their own necks to protect against spreading the coronavirus.
The “very significant change” to traditional medal ceremonies in the 339 events was revealed Wednesday by International Olympic Committee president Thomas Bach.
“The medals will not be given around the neck,” Bach told international media on a conference call from Tokyo.
“They will be presented to the athlete on a tray and then the athlete will take the medal him or herself.
The Tokyo Olympics open July 23 in a state of emergency and rising numbers of COVID-19 cases in the city.

headline: Britney Spears Can Hire Own Lawyer in Conservatorship Case, Judge Rules
summarized_story:
A Los Angeles judge has said US pop star Britney Spears can choose her own lawyer in the fight to end her controversial conservatorship.
Spears demanded once again that her father, Jamie Spears, be removed from the legal agreement that has controlled her affairs for years.
Following the ruling, Spears posted an Instagram video of herself doing cartwheels in celebration with a caption thanking her fans and adding “#FreeBritney”.
Wednesday’s court ruling paves the way for Spears’ lawyer of choice, former federal prosecutor Mathew Rosengart, to take charge of the complex legal battle.
A tearful Spears told the court that under the conservatorship, her hair vitamins and coffee had been confiscated.

headline: Euro 2020 Player of Tournament, Italy Goalkeeper Donnarumma, Joins PSG
summarized_story:
Paris St-Germain have completed the signing of Italy keeper Gianluigi Donnarumma on a free transfer.
The 22-year-old joins PSG after being named the player of the tournament as Italy won Euro 2020 on Sunday.
Donnarumma, who has signed a five-year deal at PSG, announced earlier this week he was leaving AC Milan after his contract expired.
AC Milan have already signed a replacement for Donnarumma in France’s Mike Maignan, who helped Lille beat PSG to the Ligue 1 title last season.
PSG president Nasser Al-Khelaifi said they are “pleased to welcome” Donnarumma to the club and congratulated him on his Euro 2020 successes.
